document.description: Berlitz Where to Go in Hong Kong
document.name: WhereToHongKong

lexUnit.definition: COD: a length of something wound in a joined sequence of concentric rings.

sentence.text: Mrs Wilson dressed quietly and respectably in floating grey or black , the large hat which covered her coils of iron-grey hair complementing her height .
The road worsened as I edged gingerly down along the country 's sunken spine , vanishing at times in coils of thick black mud .
The thick coils of hair had been pinned up beneath it by a patient Sister Anne , who sighed as she went about her task .
She tried to control an urge to pull at the ropes of jewels , coils of bracelets , the heavy tiara pressing into her scalp .
Liessa reached up and removed her helmet , letting the coils of red hair tumble out .
When she examined his eye she saw the splinter , a tiny coil of metal shaving which appeared to be sticking to the iris .
` You 're an architect , someone who 's supposed to improve this planet , not festoon it with ill-placed coils of lurid metal .
This powered a number of small engines with gleaming copper coils .
Some of them had brought their wooden spindles and , from time to time , they abstractedly twisted them , spinning coils of fluffy wool into a smooth yarn as they talked or listened .
He punched his way through , tearing an opening in what must have been the thing 's gut ( for sinuous tubes were visible there , coils of transparent rubber that could only have been intestines ) .
Coils of steam writhed off the wet grass under the early heat of the sun .
Her cheeks were pink , and a couple of coils of copper hair had fallen from her hairdo , one on each side of her head .
He touched the coil of rotting flesh with his free hand , pulling it slowly free .
And he reserved a ladder and a coil of rope , always to be ready .
On the far side of Farringdon Road , Graham passed Easton Street where another painter 's or window-cleaner 's cradle lay on the pavement , up-ended for some reason , neat coils of rope around it .
Over her shoulder , Britta could see coils of smoke .
A long train of timber wagons and oil tanks was being shunted around a siding and the locomotive laid a coil of black smoke across the white landscape .
Three men got out , two oldish ones and a youth , and began unloading tools and drills , and a huge coil of shiny new barbed wire was dumped in the wet grass .
In the metal and spring-making department the floor was littered with pieces of metal , coils of wire and shavings ; the surface of the floor was greasy and the premises generally filthy .
Before he left , Chagall twisted a coil of stout wire around the door handle twenty-five times , certain that the one hundred and fifty paintings he had left inside would be secure .
I saw the massed coils of barbed wire , the tall wooden towers and the muffled sentries that we had passed on the night I arrived .
In a simple dynamo , an electric current is produced in a coil of wire by rotating the coil between opposite magnetic poles .
Visitors entering the temple are confronted by a dense pall of smoke from all the burning joss sticks and the incense coils hanging from the ceiling ( these will burn for as long as a month ) .
Just up a lane from the market is the Man Mo Temple , with long-burning incense coils hanging from its ceiling , a popular spot dedicated to the Taoist gods of war and literature .
